MS MCQs

    Azure Kubernetes Service deployment pipeline and GitHub Actions - Understand application images

    »

    1. What is a Docker image?

      A zipped directory with code we can download and run on any platform or computer by using Docker.

      A standalone, lightweight package that includes all that’s needed to run the application in a container.

      A snapshot of our current working directory hosted in the cloud.


    2. What are the main advantages of using a Docker image?

      Despite being much heavier than standard VMs, Docker images are simpler and faster to deploy.

      The only advantage is that images can be hosted by using container registers, so they’re easier to download and run.

      Images are smaller and much faster than a VM, and they don’t contain useless OS data.
